title: Johnson & Johnson: Is The Dividend Still Safe After The Kenvue Split-Off?
text: JNJ stock occupies a top spot in many portfolios due to its consistent performance and low volatility. But should we really and readily accept JNJ as a SWAN stock? A fresh look at Johnson & Johnson is warranted, especially in light of the split-off of its Consumer Health segment (Kenvue stock) and amid the ongoing talc litigation. I share my view on JNJ's two remaining segments, their future prospects, and the decline in cash flow due to the split-off of the Consumer Health segment.
